com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice

Interface INetworkSearchService


  • public interface INetworkSearchService
    A set of methods for performing network searches against the Items in the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage.
    Since:
    4.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SearchResults retrieve(String searchToken, ItemTypeIdList itemTypeIds, FilterInfoList filterInfos, SortInfo sortInfo, int maxResultCount, PageInfo pageInfo)
      Retrieves SearchResults created by a previous call to search, allowing sorting and additional filtering to be carried out.
      SearchSummary search(NetworkSearchNodeList networkSearch)
      Searches the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage for groups of Items that together meet the assembled criteria of the nodes in a network, returning a SearchSummary.

      Performs a one-step search and retrieve operation, combining the functionality of search and retrieve into a single call.
      void validateSearch(NetworkSearchNodeList networkSearch)
      Validates the specified NetworkSearchNodeList according to the same rules as search, but without performing the search operation.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        SearchSummary search(NetworkSearchNodeList networkSearch)
              throws NodeUsesTooLargeSetException,
                     NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException,
                     NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException,
                     InvalidArgumentException,
                     NetworkSearchValidationException
        Searches the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage for groups of Items that together meet the assembled criteria of the nodes in a network, returning a SearchSummary. Groups of Items are included in or excluded from the SearchSummary depending on whether individual Items match the specified NetworkSearchNodes. The SearchNodes in NetworkSearchNodes must be populated following the same rules as the arguments to ISearchService.search.

        Groups of Items appear (or do not appear) in the SearchSummary according to the same security and prohibition rules as those for ISearchService.search, which are applied to the individual Items in the group.

        Parameters:
        networkSearch - A NetworkSearchNodeList that contains NetworkSearchNodes that define the criteria and structure that Items must match.

        If the NetworkSearchNodeList contains a single EntityNetworkSearchNode, then SearchNode.getItemTypeIds() for that node must return only EntityType identifiers (or null to represent all EntityTypes).

        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        NodeUsesTooLargeSetException - If the search cannot be processed because one of the nodes matches a set that contains too many items.
        NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException - If the search cannot be processed because one of the nodes matches more items than the server allows.
        NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException - If the search cannot be processed because it matches more networks than the server allows.
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        NetworkSearchValidationException - If one of the following network structure rules is broken, or if any other network search validation error occurs:
        • A network must contain at least one NetworkSearchNode.
        • Every NetworkSearchNode must be connected to at least one other NetworkSearchNode, unless there is only one EntityNetworkSearchNode in the network.
        • Every LinkNetworkSearchNode must be connected to two EntityNetworkSearchNodes.
        • NetworkSearchNode identifiers must be unique within the network.

      • retrieve

        SearchResults retrieve(String searchToken,
                       ItemTypeIdList itemTypeIds,
                       FilterInfoList filterInfos,
                       SortInfo sortInfo,
                       int maxResultCount,
                       PageInfo pageInfo)
                throws NodeUsesTooLargeSetException,
                       NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException,
                       NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException,
                       InvalidArgumentException,
                       StringArgumentTooLongException,
                       ValidationException
        Retrieves SearchResults created by a previous call to search, allowing sorting and additional filtering to be carried out. Sorting and filtering depend on whether Items:
        • Have an ItemType with a specified identifier.
        • Contain Propertys with specified (ranges of) values.
        See the search documentation for the rules that govern whether an Item appears in the SearchResults at all. The following rules then determine how it appears.

        An Item is returned as an ItemPlaceholder when:

        • The user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.READ_CLOAKED on the Item.
        • The Item is a deleted end Entity of a Link that has been returned.
        An Item is returned as an Item when:
        • The Item is not deleted, and the user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.READ_ONLY (or above) on the Item.
        The returned SearchResults do not contain highlighting information in the CardInfos.
        Parameters:
        searchToken - A String that identifies the results to retrieve.
        itemTypeIds - An ItemTypeIdList containing identifiers for the ItemTypes that matching Items must have. This ItemTypeIdList must contain a subset of the identifiers involved in the call to search, or null to match all legal ItemTypes.
        filterInfos - A FilterInfoList defining Property and metadata values that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items. This parameter must be null when itemTypeIds identifies more than one ItemType.
        sortInfo - A SortInfo determining how the retrieved Items are to be ordered.
        maxResultCount - The maximum number of Items to return to the client, which must not be negative.
        pageInfo - A PageInfo indicating which page of results to retrieve.
        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        NodeUsesTooLargeSetException - If the search cannot be processed because one of the nodes matches a set that contains too many items.
        NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException - If the search cannot be processed because one of the nodes matches more items than the server allows.
        NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException - If the search cannot be processed because it matches more networks than the server allows.
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        StringArgumentTooLongException - If a String in any of the arguments is too long.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.

      • searchAndRetrieve

        SearchResults searchAndRetrieve(NetworkSearchNodeList networkSearch,
                                ItemTypeIdList itemTypeIds,
                                FilterInfoList filterInfos,
                                SortInfo sortInfo,
                                int maxResultCount,
                                PageInfo pageInfo)
                         throws NodeUsesTooLargeSetException,
                                NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException,
                                NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException,
                                InvalidArgumentException,
                                NetworkSearchValidationException,
                                StringArgumentTooLongException,
                                ValidationException
        Performs a one-step search and retrieve operation, combining the functionality of search and retrieve into a single call.

        See the search and retrieve documentation for the rules that govern whether and how an Item appears in the SearchResults.

        The returned SearchResults do not contain highlighting information in the CardInfos.

        Parameters:
        networkSearch - A NetworkSearchNodeList that contains NetworkSearchNodes that define the criteria and structure that Items must match.
        itemTypeIds - An ItemTypeIdList containing identifiers for the ItemTypes that matching Items must have. This ItemTypeIdList must contain a subset of the identifiers specified in networkSearch, or null to match all legal ItemTypes.
        filterInfos - A FilterInfoList defining Property and metadata values that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items. This parameter must be null when itemTypeIds identifies more than one ItemType.
        sortInfo - A SortInfo determining how the retrieved Items are to be ordered.
        maxResultCount - The maximum number of Items to return to the client, which must not be negative.
        pageInfo - A PageInfo indicating which page of results to retrieve.
        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        NodeUsesTooLargeSetException - If the search cannot be processed because one of the nodes matches a set that contains too many items.
        NodeMatchesTooManyItemsException - If the search cannot be processed because one of the nodes matches more items than the server allows.
        NetworkSearchMatchesTooManyNetworksException - If the search cannot be processed because it matches more networks than the server allows.
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        NetworkSearchValidationException - If one of the following network structure rules is broken, or if any other network search validation error occurs:
        • A network must contain at least one NetworkSearchNode.
        • Every NetworkSearchNode must be connected to at least one other NetworkSearchNode, unless there is only one EntityNetworkSearchNode in the network.
        • Every LinkNetworkSearchNode must be connected to two EntityNetworkSearchNodes.
        • NetworkSearchNode identifiers must be unique within the network.
        StringArgumentTooLongException - If a String in any of the retrieve arguments is too long.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.

      • validateSearch

        void validateSearch(NetworkSearchNodeList networkSearch)
             throws InvalidArgumentException,
                    NetworkSearchValidationException
        Validates the specified NetworkSearchNodeList according to the same rules as search, but without performing the search operation.

        A client that saves network search structures can call this method to verify that a structure is valid, without the overhead of running the search itself.

        Parameters:
        networkSearch - A NetworkSearchNodeList that contains NetworkSearchNodes that define the criteria and structure that Items must match.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        NetworkSearchValidationException - If one of the following network structure rules is broken, or if any other network search validation error occurs:
        • A network must contain at least one NetworkSearchNode.
        • Every NetworkSearchNode must be connected to at least one other NetworkSearchNode, unless there is only one EntityNetworkSearchNode in the network.
        • Every LinkNetworkSearchNode must be connected to two EntityNetworkSearchNodes.
        • NetworkSearchNode identifiers must be unique within the network.
